name: Instance
description: Creates an instance for an AWS OpsWorks stack. These instances are the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances that, for example, handle the work of serving applications and balancing traffic.

properties.name: AmiId
properties.description: The ID of the custom Amazon Machine Image (AMI) to be used to create the instance. For more information about custom AMIs, see Using Custom AMIs in the AWS OpsWorks User Guide.

properties.name: AutoScalingType
properties.description: For scaling instances, the type of scaling. If you specify load-based scaling, do not specify a time-based scaling configuration. For valid values, see CreateInstance in the AWS OpsWorks API Reference.

properties.name: EbsOptimized
properties.description: Whether the instance is optimized for Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) I/O. If you specify an Amazon EBS-optimized instance type, AWS OpsWorks enables EBS optimization by default. For more information, see Amazon EBSâ€“Optimized Instances in the Amazon EC2 User Guide for Linux Instances.

properties.name: InstallUpdatesOnBoot
properties.description: Whether to install operating system and package updates when the instance boots.

properties.name: InstanceType
properties.description: The instance type, which must be supported by AWS OpsWorks. For more information, see CreateInstance in the AWS OpsWorks API Reference.

properties.name: LayerIds
properties.description: The IDs of the AWS OpsWorks layers to associate with this instance.

properties.name: Os
properties.description: The instance operating system. For more information, see CreateInstance in the AWS OpsWorks API Reference.

properties.name: RootDeviceType
properties.description: The root device type of the instance.

properties.name: SshKeyName
properties.description: The SSH key name of the instance.

properties.name: StackId
properties.description: The ID of the AWS OpsWorks stack that this instance will be associated with.

properties.name: SubnetId
properties.description: The ID of the instance's subnet. If the stack is running in a VPC, you can use this parameter to override the stack's default subnet ID value and direct AWS OpsWorks to launch the instance in a different subnet.

properties.name: TimeBasedAutoScaling
properties.description: The time-based scaling configuration for the instance.
